free.chess
Class ChesslikeGenericVariant

java.lang.Object
  free.chess.ChesslikeGenericVariant
All Implemented Interfaces:
WildVariant
Direct Known Subclasses:
Chess
public class ChesslikeGenericVariant
extends java.lang.Object
implements WildVariant

Implements WildVariant for chesslike variants. Subclasses must only define the initial position and the name of the variant. Although this class is not abstract, directly instantiating it is discouraged except for cases where the name or the initial position is unknown at compile time. When the initial position and the name are known at compile time, its best to instantiate a subclass which defines them.

This class also provides some methods for determining the various properties of a move in the game of chess (en-passant, promotion, castling, etc.). Variants that only differ from chess in their definition of these terms can override these methods and implement them accordingly. Note that it is not necessary to override the createMove(Position, Square, Square, Piece, String) method as it already calls the forementioned methods when determining the properties of the created ChessMove.

Method Detail

isEnPassant

public boolean isEnPassant(Position pos,
                           Square startingSquare,
                           Square endingSquare,
                           ChessPiece promotionTarget)
Returns true if the chess move defined by the given arguments is an en-passant move. Returns false otherwise. The result for an illegal move is undefined, but it should throw no exceptions.

isShortCastling

public boolean isShortCastling(Position pos,
                               Square startingSquare,
                               Square endingSquare,
                               ChessPiece promotionTarget)
Returns true if the move defined by the given arguments is a short castling move. Returns false otherwise. The result for an illegal move is undefined, but it should throw no exceptions.

public boolean isLongCastling(Position pos,
                              Square startingSquare,
                              Square endingSquare,
                              ChessPiece promotionTarget)
Returns true if the move defined by the given arguments is a long castling move. Returns false otherwise. The result for an illegal move is undefined, but it should throw no exceptions.

getCapturedPiece

public ChessPiece getCapturedPiece(Position pos,
                                   Square startingSquare,
                                   Square endingSquare,
                                   ChessPiece promotionTarget)
Returns the piece captured by the move defined by the given arguments. Returns null if none. The result for an illegal move is undefined, but it should throw no exceptions. This is a convenience method which determines whether the move defined by the given properties is an en-passant by invoking isEnPassant(Position, Square, Square, ChessPiece). Keep in mind that the called method may be overriden.

getCapturedPiece

public ChessPiece getCapturedPiece(Position pos,
                                   Square startingSquare,
                                   Square endingSquare,
                                   ChessPiece promotionTarget,
                                   boolean isEnPassant)
Returns the piece captured by the move defined by the given arguments. Returns null if none. The result for an illegal move is undefined, but it should throw no exceptions.

checkPosition

protected void checkPosition(Position pos)
Returns normally (and does nothing) if the given Position object can be used with this WildVariant. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the given Position object cannot be used with this WildVariant. The default implementation throws an IllegalArgumentException if the given Position object's wild variant is different from this one. The comparison is done by calling the equals(Object) method.

init

public void init(Position pos)
Sets the initial position of this chess variant on the given Position object.

Specified by:
init in interface WildVariant
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given Position is incompatible with this WildVariant as defined by checkPosition(Position)

getPromotionTargets

public Piece[] getPromotionTargets(Position pos,
                                   Square startingSquare,
                                   Square endingSquare)

If the a move created by the given starting square and ending square in the given position is a promotion, returns an array containing a knight, bishop, rook and queen of the color of the promoted pawn. Otherwise returns null.

If you want to use this method from the implementation of some other wild variant, use the static getChessPromotionTargets(Position, Square, Square) method instead - it doesn't check the wild variant of the position.

Specified by:
getPromotionTargets in interface WildVariant
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given Position is incompatible with this WildVariant as defined by checkPosition(Position)

getChessPromotionTargets

public static Piece[] getChessPromotionTargets(Position pos,
                                               Square startingSquare,
                                               Square endingSquare)
Returns the same thing as getPromotionTargets(Position, Square, Square), only it's static and doesn't check the wild variant of the position. This method is useful for other wild variants who have the same promotion targets and don't want to rewrite the functionality. The only constraint is that the piece at the piece at the starting square has to be a ChessPiece.

createMove

public Move createMove(Position pos,
                       Square startingSquare,
                       Square endingSquare,
                       Piece promotionTarget,
                       java.lang.String moveSAN)
Creates a ChessMove from the given starting square and ending square in the given Position. If the move is not a promotion, promotionTarget should be null. The ChessMove is created with the constructor which takes all the properties. The properties are determined by calling the various methods in this class that determine those properties. This means that overriding these methods and redefining their behaviour is the only thing needed to implement variants which are mildly different from Chess.

Specified by:
createMove in interface WildVariant
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given Position is incompatible with this WildVariant as defined by checkPosition(Position)
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the promotionTarget is not null and is not an instance of ChessPiece.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the there is no piece at the starting square.

makeMove

public void makeMove(Move move,
                     Position pos,
                     Position.Modifier modifier)

Makes the given ChessMove in the given Position. This method shoudln't (and can't) be called directly - call Position.makeMove(Move) instead.

If you want to use this method from an implementation of some other wild variant, use the static makeChessMove(ChessMove, Position, Position.Modifier) method instead - it doesn't check the wild variant of the position.

Specified by:
makeMove in interface WildVariant
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given Position is incompatible with this WildVariant as defined by checkPosition(Position)
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given Move is not an instance of ChessMove.

makeChessMove

public static void makeChessMove(ChessMove cmove,
                                 Position pos,
                                 Position.Modifier modifier)
Makes the given ChessMove on the given Position using the given position modifier. This method is here solely for the benefit of WildVariant implementations which sometimes need to make a regular ChessMove on a position and don't want to reimplement this method.
